text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Nigeria has lost 285,000 sq km of land area to various forms of soil degradation in the last five years, according to ministry of agriculture statistics.
- Military government gives $42 million grant to ailing national carrier Nigeria Airways for repair and maintenance of its grounded fleet.
- Policeman kills one bus passenger and wounds three others in shooting incident linked to alleged bribe dispute with driver at checkpoint in southwestern Ijebu-Mushin town.
- Each of five registered political parties send their agents to centres to check allegations of fraud in voter registration for municipal elections in March.
- State-insurer NICON plans to acquire controlling shares in some viable banks and insurance companies.
- Three of five registered political parties plan to adopt military ruler General Sani Abacha as consensus candidate for next year's presidential election, paper says, quoting own investigations.
- Gunmen kill Lagos businessman Hakeem Nollah at his home.

- Nigeria has lost 28.4 billion naira in European Union technical aid porgrammes since last year when the EU imposed sanctions on the military government for alleged human rights abuses and lack of democracy, paper's investigations show.
